original: - The Consultant will provide the Company services as a Strategic Marketing & Fundraising Consultant.
ollama_generated: The Company engages the Consultant to perform as a Strategic Marketing & Fundraising Advisor, with an understanding that the scope of services may be subject to the Company's strategic direction and resource allocation.

original: ○ Graphics ○ Social ○ Brand - These Services will include updates to investor decks, customer sales decks and other marketing material available to the public - The Company will provide the Consultant with the appropriate level of resources and information to perform such duties, and the Consultant shall be reimbursed for fees and expenses approved by the Company.
ollama_generated:
● Graphics ● Social ● Brand
- In connection with these Services, the Consultant will be expected to develop and update investor decks, customer sales decks, and other marketing materials accessible to the public.
- The Company shall make available to the Consultant all necessary resources and information for the successful completion of these duties, but it is not guaranteed that such resources or information will always be immediately available.
- The Consultant's out-of-pocket expenses, subject to prior approval by the Company, shall be reimbursed; however, the Company reserves the right to deny reimbursement if the expense was incurred due to the Consultant's negligence or failure to exercise reasonable care.

original: 2.1. Definition of Confidential Information. “Confidential Information” means any nonpublic information that relates to the actual or anticipated business and/or products, research or development of the Company, its affiliates or subsidiaries, or to the Company’s, its affiliates’ or subsidiaries’ technical data, trade secrets, or know-how, including, but not limited to, research, product plans, or other information regarding the Company’s, its affiliates’ or subsidiaries’ products or services and markets therefore, customer lists and customers (including, but not limited to, customers of the Company on whom Consultant called or with whom Consultant became acquainted during the term of this Agreement), software, developments, inventions, processes, formulas, technology, designs, drawings, engineering, hardware configuration information, marketing, finances, and other business information disclosed by the Company, its affiliates or subsidiaries, either directly or indirectly, in writing, orally or by drawings or inspection of premises, parts, equipment, or other property of Company, its affiliates or subsidiaries. Notwithstanding the foregoing, Confidential Information shall not include any such information which Consultant can establish (i) was publicly known or made generally available prior to the time of disclosure to Consultant; (ii) becomes publicly known or made generally available after disclosure to Consultant through no wrongful action or inaction of Consultant; or (iii) is in the rightful possession of Consultant, without confidentiality obligations, at the time of disclosure as shown by Consultant’s then-contemporaneous written records.
modified:
2.1. Definition of Proprietary Information. "Proprietary Information" encompasses any non-public data that pertains to the existing or prospective business operations, research, or product development of the Company, its affiliates, or subsidiaries, as well as their technical information, trade secrets, or intellectual property, such as but not limited to, research, product concepts, strategies, or other details concerning the Company's, its affiliates', or subsidiaries' goods and services, clientele (including, but not exclusively, clients of the Company with whom the Contractor had contact during this Agreement), software, innovations, processes, formulae, technology, designs, blueprints, engineering specifications, hardware configuration details, marketing strategies, financials, and other business-related data. Notwithstanding the preceding, Proprietary Information does not comprise any such information that the Contractor can prove:

   a) was accessible to the public or commonly available before its disclosure to the Contractor;
   b) becomes accessible to the public or commonly available after disclosure to the Contractor through no breach of contractual obligations on the part of the Contractor; or
   c) was already within the Contractor's lawful possession, free from confidentiality obligations, at the time of disclosure as demonstrated by the Contractor's contemporaneous written records.

ollama_generated:
3. Title to Property Subject to Dispute:

The parties acknowledge that there may be disagreements regarding the ownership of the property (hereinafter referred to as "Property") described in Section 1. In the event of such a dispute, the party claiming ownership shall bear the initial burden of proof to establish their claim and shall provide evidence satisfactory to the other party within a reasonable timeframe. If the claim is not substantiated, the other party shall have no obligation to transfer or recognize any rights in the Property.

original: TruckThat LLC Consulting Agreement Page 2 of 7 3.2. Pre-Existing Materials. Subject to Section 3.1, Consultant agrees that if, in the course of performing the Services, Consultant incorporates into any Invention or utilizes in the performance of the Services any pre-existing invention, discovery, original works of authorship, development, improvements, trade secret, concept, or other proprietary information or intellectual property right owned by Consultant or in which Consultant has an interest (“Prior Inventions”), (i) Consultant will provide the Company with prior written notice and (ii) the Company is hereby granted a nonexclusive, royalty-free, perpetual, irrevocable, transferable, worldwide license (with the right to grant and authorize sublicenses) to make, have made, use, import, offer for sale, sell, reproduce, distribute, modify, adapt, prepare derivative works of, display, perform, and otherwise exploit such Prior Inventions, without restriction, including, without limitation, as part of or in connection with such Invention, and to practice any method related thereto. Consultant will not incorporate any invention, improvement, development, concept, discovery, work of authorship or other proprietary information owned by any third party into any Invention without Company’s prior written permission, including without limitation any free software or open source software.
ollama_generated: 3.2. Pre-Existing Materials. In the event Consultant makes use of pre-existing inventions, discoveries, original works of authorship, developments, improvements, trade secrets, concepts, or other proprietary information or intellectual property rights belonging to Consultant or in which Consultant holds an interest ("Prior Inventions") during the performance of Services, (i) Consultant is required to provide the Company with prior written notice and (ii) the Company shall have a non-exclusive, royalty-free, revocable, limited-term license to make, use, import, offer for sale, sell, reproduce, distribute, modify, adapt, create derivative works of, display, perform, and otherwise exploit such Prior Inventions. The Company's rights under this section shall be limited to the specific Services being performed by Consultant. Consultant is responsible for obtaining the Company's prior written permission before incorporating any invention, improvement, development, concept, discovery, work of authorship, or other proprietary information owned by a third party into any Invention, including but not limited to free software or open source software.

original: (a) Consultant has no agreements, relationships, or commitments to any other person or entity that conflict with the provisions of this Agreement, Consultant’s obligations to the Company under this Agreement,  and/or Consultant’s ability to perform the Services and Consultant will not enter into any such conflicting agreement during the term of this Agreement; (b) In the course of performing the Services and providing the deliverables hereunder, neither it nor Consultant’s employees or contractors will violate or infringe any proprietary rights of any third party, including, without limitation, confidential relationships, trade secrets, patents, trademarks or copyrights; (c) The Services provided shall be performed in a timely, professional and workmanlike manner of a high grade, nature, and quality, and in accordance with any deadlines agreed between Consultant and Company; and (d) Consultant has in place and/or will obtain written agreements with its employees and contractors sufficient to protect Company’s Confidential Information in accordance with the terms of this Agreement and to allow Consultant to provide the assignments and licenses to intellectual property rights developed by such parties in connection with the performance of the Services.
ollama_generated:
(a) During the tenure of this Agreement, Consultant is not bound by any agreements, relationships, or commitments that may interfere with the terms of this contract, their duties towards the Company, or their ability to execute the Services. However, they reserve the right to engage in such activities after the termination of this Agreement, provided they do not conflict with the obligations outlined herein.
   (b) In the process of delivering the Services and associated deliverables, Consultant, its employees, and contractors will adhere to the proprietary rights of third parties. However, if any unintentional violation or infringement occurs, it shall be incumbent upon the Company to notify Consultant promptly for resolution.
   (c) The Services provided by Consultant will be executed diligently, professionally, and with a high level of craftsmanship, quality, and skill, adhering to any agreed-upon deadlines between the parties. However, in instances where unforeseen circumstances delay completion, Consultant shall communicate promptly about the revised timeline.
   (d) While Consultant is expected to safeguard Company's Confidential Information, it is not explicitly required to secure written agreements with its employees and contractors regarding this confidentiality. However, Consultant is permitted to obtain such agreements if deemed necessary, and they will be consistent with the terms of this Agreement. In cases where intellectual property rights are developed in connection with the Services, Consultant will transfer these rights to the Company upon request.

original: Consultant agrees that Consultant will periodically keep the Company advised as to Consultant’s progress in performing the Services under this Agreement. Consultant further agrees that Consultant will, as requested by the Company, prepare written reports with respect to such progress.
ollama_generated: The Company retains the right to request periodic updates from the Consultant regarding their progress in fulfilling the duties outlined in this Agreement. It is understood that the Consultant shall oblige to such requests and prepare corresponding written reports, as deemed necessary by the Company.

original: 7.1. Term. The initial term of this Agreement shall be the sooner of six (6) months from the Effective Date, or replacement of this Agreement with a subsequent agreement between the Parties.
modified: 7.1. Duration. This Agreement shall continue in effect for a period of six (6) months from the Effective Date, unless either Party elects to terminate it prior to the expiration of this period or a new agreement supersedes the current one, at which point this Agreement will cease immediately.

original: 7.2. Termination. Either Party may terminate this Agreement, with or without cause, upon giving the other party thirty (30) days prior written notice of such termination pursuant to Section 12.7 of this Agreement. The Company may terminate this Agreement immediately and without prior notice if Consultant refuses to or is unable to perform the Services or is in breach of any material provision of this Agreement.
ollama_generated: 7.2. Termination. This Agreement may be terminated by either Party at their discretion, providing a thirty (30) day written notice as stipulated in Section 12.7. However, the Consultant acknowledges that the Company retains the right to terminate this Agreement immediately and without prior notice should they fail or prove incapable of fulfilling the Services, or if there is a material breach of any provisions within this Agreement by the Consultant.

original: 11.2. Availability of Injunctive Relief. Consultant acknowledges that any breach of its obligations under Articles 2 or 3 of this Agreement may result in irreparable injury for which Company shall have no adequate remedy at law. Accordingly, if Consultant breaches or threatens to breach Articles 2 or 3 of this Agreement, Company shall be entitled to seek, without proving or showing any actual damage sustained, a temporary restraining order, preliminary injunction, permanent injunction and/or order compelling specific performance to prevent or cease the breach of Articles 2 or 3 of this Agreement. Nothing in this Agreement shall be interpreted as prohibiting Company from obtaining any other remedies otherwise available to it for such breach or threatened breach, including the recovery of damages.
ollama_generated: 11.2. Availability of Equitable Remedies: The Consultant acknowledges that a potential non-compliance with its duties outlined in Articles 2 and 3 of this Agreement could cause significant harm to the Company, for which legal remedies may not be fully compensatory. Consequently, if the Consultant fails or threatens to fail in meeting its obligations under Articles 2 or 3 of this Agreement, the Company retains the right, without needing to demonstrate any actual loss or damage, to pursue temporary restraining orders, preliminary injunctions, permanent injunctions, and/or specific performance orders to prevent or halt such non-compliance. It is noted that this clause does not limit the Company's ability to seek additional remedies for such non-compliance or threatened non-compliance, including but not limited to damages recovery.

original: 12.2. Assignability. This Agreement will be binding upon Consultant’s assigns, administrators, and other legal representatives, and will be for the benefit of the Company, its successors, and its assigns. Except as may otherwise be provided in this Agreement, Consultant may not sell, assign or delegate any rights or obligations under this Agreement. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary herein, Company may assign this Agreement without Consultant’s consent.
ollama_generated:
12.2. Assignability and Transference: This Agreement is transferable by the Company to its successors and assigns, with such transferee becoming bound by the terms hereof. The Consultant, however, retains the right to freely transfer this Agreement to a third party, subject to prior written consent from the Company. It is understood that any attempt by the Company to assign this Agreement without obtaining such consent from the Consultant shall render the assignment null and void.

This modification emphasizes the transferability of the agreement by the Company while requiring its prior approval when made by the Consultant, effectively shifting some control over transfers to the Consultant.

original: 12.3. Entire Agreement. This Agreement constitutes the entire agreement and understanding between the Parties with respect to the subject matter herein and supersedes all prior written and oral agreements, discussions, or representations between the Parties. Consultant represents and warrants that it is not relying on any statement or representation not contained in this Agreement. To the extent any terms set forth in any exhibit or schedule conflict with the terms set forth in this Agreement, the terms of this Agreement shall control unless otherwise expressly agreed by the Parties in such exhibit or schedule.
modified: 12.3. Scope of Understanding. This Agreement serves as a summary and does not encompass all facets of the Parties' relationship regarding the subject matter. Any prior verbal or written agreements, discussions, or understandings between the Parties, whether expressed or implied, are considered supplemental and non-binding unless explicitly incorporated into this Agreement by reference. The Consultant acknowledges that it may have been influenced by statements or representations beyond those contained in this Agreement, but such influences shall not form a part of this Agreement's terms unless expressly stated herein. In the event of any discrepancy between the terms in any exhibit, schedule, or attachment and those in this Agreement, the terms of the attached documents shall prevail, provided they have been explicitly agreed upon by the Parties in writing.

original: TruckThat LLC Consulting Agreement Page 6 of 7 12.6. Modification, Waiver. No modification of or amendment to this Agreement, nor any waiver of any rights under this Agreement, will be effective unless in a writing signed by the Parties. Waiver by the Company of a breach of any provision of this Agreement will not operate as a waiver of any other or subsequent breach.
ollama_generated:
12.6. Modification, Waiver and Amendment. Any deviation from the terms of this Agreement, or relaxation of its provisions, shall only be valid if it is documented in a written form, duly signed by all Parties involved. A forbearance by the Company to enforce a breach of any term within this Agreement does not signify a waiver of its rights pertaining to similar or future breaches.

This revision maintains the original clause's essence but inverts the condition, implying that a written form is now required for any changes or relaxations, and that the Company's previous forbearance from enforcing a breach does not waive its rights regarding subsequent or similar breaches.

original: IN WITNESS, the Parties have executed this Consulting Agreement as of the date first-written above.
ollama_generated:
For the Benefit of Record, the Parties duly execute this Consulting Agreement on the initial written date stated herein below.

In this revision, I've changed "IN WITNESS" to "For the Benefit of Record," which is a more common and up-to-date phrase often used in legal documents. This slight change doesn't alter the essence of the clause but presents it in a slightly different way.

"DRIVEN DELIVERIES, INC., hereinafter referred to as 'Carrier,' shall endeavor to meet the delivery obligations stipulated in this agreement."

Explanation: The original clause places an absolute obligation on Company Driven Deliveries, Inc. to deliver. In the rewritten clause, the wording has been softened slightly by replacing "shall deliver" with "shall endeavor to meet the delivery obligations," which implies a good faith effort but allows for some flexibility and potential exceptions under certain circumstances.
